title: NBA Daily News Digest
subtitle: February 17, 2026 - All-Star Weekend Aftermath & League Updates

items.headline: Anthony Edwards Crowned All-Star MVP as New Format Shines
items.summary: MIN's Anthony Edwards led the USA Stars to victory in the inaugural 'USA vs. World' All-Star Game, earning MVP honors. The new format proved a ratings success, drawing the biggest audience in 15 years.

items.headline: Deni Avdija Makes History with First All-Star Appearance
items.summary: POR's Deni Avdija became the first Israeli player to participate in the NBA All-Star Game, representing Team World. He contributed 5 points, 4 assists, and 1 rebound in 15 minutes of play across two mini-games.

items.headline: Commissioner Silver Vows to Tackle Tanking Problem
items.summary: NBA Commissioner Adam Silver addressed the league's 'tanking' concerns during All-Star Weekend, stating he is exploring 'every possible remedy' and citing recent fines levied against the UTA Jazz ($500,000) and IND Pacers ($100,000) for roster management.

items.headline: USA Stars claim All-Star Championship
items.summary: In the championship game of the new All-Star mini-tournament, the USA Stars dominated the USA Stripes.

items.headline: USA Stars edge Team World in OT thriller
items.summary: The opening game of the All-Star mini-tournament went down to the wire, with the USA Stars winning in overtime.

items.headline: USA Stripes hit buzzer-beater against USA Stars
items.summary: A clutch 3-pointer at the buzzer secured a narrow victory for the USA Stripes in their matchup against the USA Stars.

items.headline: Anthony Edwards Shines as All-Star MVP
items.statContext: Across 3 mini-games for USA Stars MVP.

items.headline: Kawhi Leonard's 31-Point Explosion
items.statContext: In one 12-minute All-Star mini-game for USA Stripes, including a game-winning three-pointer.

items.headline: Wemby Leads Team World Scoring
items.statContext: Across two mini-games for Team World.

items.headline: Deni Avdija's Impressive Season Averages
items.statContext: The Israeli All-Star is having a breakout season for the POR Trail Blazers, including 14 double-doubles and 3 triple-doubles.

items.headline: Damian Lillard Wins 3-Point Contest
items.statContext: The POR guard showcased his elite shooting, winning his third career 3-Point Contest title.

items.headline: All-Star Game Ratings Soar with New Format
items.summary: The 2026 NBA All-Star Game achieved its highest viewership in 15 years, with 8.8 million viewers tuning in across NBC, Peacock, and Telemundo, an 87% increase from last year. The 'USA vs. World' format is credited for the significant boost.

items.headline: LeBron James Undecided on Retirement After 23rd Season
items.summary: LAL superstar LeBron James indicated he is still unsure whether his current 23rd NBA season will be his last, stating, 'When I know, you guys will know.'

items.headline: Star Injury Updates: Doncic, Jokic, Curry Cautious at All-Star
items.summary: DAL's Luka Doncic (hamstring) and DEN's Nikola Jokic (knee bone bruise) played limited minutes in the All-Star Game as a precaution. GSW's Stephen Curry also sat out the weekend due to a knee injury.

items.headline: Giannis Stays Put as Trade Deadline Passes
items.summary: Despite intense speculation, MIL's Giannis Antetokounmpo was not traded before the February 5th deadline. Other notable moves included Anthony Davis to WAS, James Harden to CLE, and Jaren Jackson Jr. to UTA.

items.headline: No NBA Games Scheduled Today; Regular Season Resumes Thursday
items.summary: The NBA schedule for February 17, 2026, shows no games scheduled as the league remains on break following All-Star Weekend. Regular season play is set to resume on Thursday, February 19th.
